text: Nordstromia undata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Watson in 1968. It is found in Yunnan, China. The length of the forewings is 17-19.5 mm for males and 17.5–21 mm for females. The ground colour of the forewings is buff, slightly darker apically. The medial fasciae and cell-spots are darker buff and the subterminal fascia is dark brown. The outer margin is edged with orange buff. The hindwings are brownish white, sometimes with traces of a postmedial and subterminal fascia at the anal margin. The discocellular spot of the under surface is usually showing through the wing.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Supplement 12: 84 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1968 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nordstromia undata
